did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Smith Club of Rhode Island Records
did.abstract: Contains correspondence, ephemera, lists, photographs, and a scrapbook.

bioghist.p: The main functions of the Club are to arrange social events for the alumnae in the area and to fundraise for Smith Fund scholarships. Their current values statement defines the Club as "a group of Smith College alumnae living in or near Rhode Island. We look to connect for networking, social events, and building ties with the college and community. We have an active book club and host several events each year, including a winter party to make care packages for current Smith students from RI."

scopecontent.p: This collection contains Club newsletters, correspondence, membership directories, clippings and photographs. The papers span from 1913 until today. The scrapbook contains newsclippings and ephemera spanning 1916 through 1918. Highlights include the Club's involvement in the community as well as in the war effort.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Smith Club of Rhode Island, Box 1, Smith College Archives

acqinfo.p: The records of the Smith Club of Rhode Island were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.
